column5: I always wet the net before fishing! Its a must!   TDunn
I don't have any crazy superstitions, lol.   Some of these are pretty interesting..
Give them a gift before you set out - a T-shirt with the word GUIDE printed on it.
I might just start doing that.  my outing at Thanksgiving I did that for some reason and got my PB musky, go figure...
Gonna give the net dip a try as well. Every time I take my net out, no teeth   . One hard and fast rule is, like others, no bananas. Highdrifter can attest to the power of the smuggled yellowpeel   .
whenever the fishing is slow, go eat lunch and something will bite while u're eating... works like a charm everytime
Wetting the net is a must!!!

Always make sure that I approach my favourite spot with metallica cranked.  Then I park and leave the doors open for 10 minutes with the music cranked to scare any bears away.  Seems to work, caught a few fish and never been eatin!
I have a lucky key chain that I rub for good luck
I'm the same. I never put 1 oz of water in the live well until the 1st fish is caught.
Yeah, I never fill the livewell unless I have a little water in it first.
When shore fishing I always wash my lure/fly in the mud in the shallow water near shore first before I use it. I wash my hands in the same mud/sand too.  muddler
Hey Me too !!!
I always dab a little "essence" of that first speck slime behind my ears ... just like an expensive cologne ... ok .. I admit it .. I actually do like the smell
When fishing to harvest......never release the first fish.......Last thing you wanna do is piss off the fish gods!
No superstitions really.  Just a bunch of things I probably do that would make me seem like I have O.C.D.  But, it gets results most times. lol
dip the net 3x - completely submerge the mesh each time  sing a song - Its ultra top secret, if i told you, i'd have to kill you...
When I ice fish with live minnows, I sometimes move a good distance away from my rod. It seems to work especially well with rainbow trout.
Oh and if I don't catch anything I blame the weather
I went fishing a few times with a member here(i wont mention your name Mike) who gets all weird if you bring a banana in his boat Something about banana boats sinking in the ocean
i catch more fish when my baileys is full of coffee if you know what i mean.

Always pay the fish gods after I set my spread. Some times 2 and 3 times in a day. Can tell you lots of money at the bottom of Lake O and bay of quinte. Anyone that has been on my boat knows it pays to pay the fish gods
Nope. Is that a superstition?
LOL
I always catch fish if i am trying to catch a quick nap so i always try to go out when i am tired.  vance

NO Bananas...  Used to be a joke until... One time halfway through a tuff day my buddy pulls a banana out of his lunch box... I jokingly give him heck... Banana peel hits the water... Couple minutes later...musky   Another time in a friends boat... One of the guys had a banana...tossed the peel when he was done... Reeled in the musky Ross at the end of the troll... The banana peel managed to get hooked on the banana eaters lure...  Crazy...
If the fish are not biting I have found a strange coincidence between being distracted by a rats nest in the reel to hooking up on a fish.  Art
I have one superstition... NO TERAPOOPA'S on Quinte! It has been confirmed and documented many times, that a "Terapoopa" in the boat, on Quinte will morf into a stripped critter in no time! HH
WTH is a terapoopa?

Just because fish aren't caught with you there, doesn't mean I'm the problem.  Caught fish just fine with Lloyd last year...LOL.  I tend to blame the guide I'm out with if nothing is caught  And there are no naked critters ever...striped maybe...

Mine started from my girlfriend,  always put some loose tobacco in the water before the first cast. Thats my superstition.  My tradition is to be well prepared, have everything where I need it, and in a tidy fashion.
Anyone can reel in a fish... not everyone can get a fish to bite! I stand by my misspelled statement... HH
so, what are you going to say to the people you take fishing in YOUR boat...
GOOGLE TERAPOOPA, THIS LINK COMES UP  http://ontariofishin...showtopic=24823

when we're fishing anywhere around the Delaware area we HAVE to stop for chester chicken in the convenience store...it's a must stop, under no circumstances is chester's chicken passed on  I also found a chester's chicken in BC, near Lytton, whenever I shore fish for sturgeon in the area we have to stop there, my BC fishin buddies don't really get it but the one time we didn't get the chicken we didn't get the sturgeon...pretty simple math there....we don't skip the chester's anymore
A Terapoopa is the community's way of having fun with a good natured member.

When in a tournament I never fill the livewell until the first fish is caught.  I had a favourite hat that blew off on Lake Ontario, it was rough and not safe to turn to get it.  I am working in a new one.
I accept full responsibility in that case...  Or I'll blame the weather or something...LOL
100% correct Roy... I wouldn't have said it had I felt it would be taken the wrong way! HH
I never bring fish on a fishing trip, no cans of tuna or sardines or whatever else, and if you bring fish on a fishing trip with me stay the h*ll outta my boat!!

No chance at that HH.  All good here  Oh...and to add one more...I never eat fish the day before a trip.  You never know if the fish you are catching can "smell" fish death on your breath and stay away...LOL.

Yes, this is true. I hope the curse can be broken next weekend. He better not bring any banana's on board. Boated fish every trip this year to Quinte, we'll wait and see what happens at the G2G.  I've got a couple of "lucky hats" so I'm not too upset it one goes missing. Not really to superstitious but Lloyd is right about paying the fish gods on the big water...forgot to do that last weekend and Joe caught the fish.  Must have been my guiding and driving skills that help that to happen as well as no Terapoopa in the boat.
no bananas and i always talk nice to my lund,and the fish gods....

I was reading the last cast thread and realized that when I am shore fishing, I always say "last cast" out loud.  When I'm in a boat fishing, I always take a picture of the first fish caught....no matter what species or how small it is...  Do you have any superstitions or rituals you do when fishing to bring you luck?  Let's hear them!
When the gas can needle is close to E, I start listen for sputtering.
When tying a double uni knot, I use 5 turns on the braid, and 6 on the mono.  11 is my lucky number.

Fishing with my brother, I always catch a walleye when he pours himself a Tea!  My favourite saying in the boat "Come on, scare me!" I say it several times during the day and more time than not, I feel the "tick" or see my line "twitch".

I have a couple.... If I see a skunk driving to a spot I suggest we just turn around and go home if I am alone I will go to a different spot than I was heading to in the first place at the very least LOL.  The other one is when fishing with my dad I always pack a lunch and it is always exactly the same, had good luck when I threw it together at the last minute one time and now I always take it along. (should maybe drop this one as we have been skunked the last 4 times out but traditions die hard)
I only have one ritual, I have to catch big fish when I fish with U & Me Charters and so far I have performed that ritual every time    LOL

As you have been in my boat, I too say this no matter where i am fishing (boat or shore)  But if you catch one (anyone in the boat or with you for that matter) you get a free 5 min. extension of fishing time before you have to say it again.  Other then that, make sure I have a lighter and smokes...

I just pray,,,,,,,,,,             That all  things will work,,,,,,,,,,                           When I fish with ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,                       No names,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,                  I just pray that alls   .
No bananas  And  If I have a feeling that fish are in a certain spot I stop there. Seems weird but it has never let me down
I find when I get the net ready on the trip it usually ends up being a slow day. If I leae it tucked away I usually have to scramble many times to get it.
Wet the net! It needs to be totally immersed in water and brought back on board or you will be skunked
ritual - I only stop at a Tim Horton's for coffee on my way fishing, otherwise I never go there (either make my own or drink the swill at work)
I forgot Beef Jerkey when fishing with someone new.
I check the weather before I choose a fishing location. It seems to work
How much spam are you going to put out for LLoyd Terry I'm sure he wants a day off sometime...  LOL
I would think not as many times as you guys move/remove them
always 3 last casts before leaving, makes a difference sometimes
I've worn my lucky hat since the 12th grade...  Other than that, I go to the bathroom before I leave the house
I always wear the same hat..... and days I haven't, well, I love the hat but it doesn't make a single bit of difference!
I used to have superstitions, but my astrologer said I was being silly. But now my palm-reader tells me my astrologer is nuts. Don't know what to do now.
Have you been in to the 'stuff' in your avatar Dave?
Only after breakfast.
I try to end the day on a high note with a caught fish.
Whenever I leave on a longer trip I always play "Three Pistols" by the Hip as the first song on the car stereo.
